adjectives.description: daredevil (comparative more daredevil, superlative most daredevil)

examples: The climactic scene of “Rebel without a Cause” is the group of very daredevil teens playing chicken.

entries.meaning: A person who engages in very risky behavior, especially one who is motivated by a craving for excitement or attention. [from 1794]
examples: Even as a youngster, Steven was a bit of a daredevil riding up homemade wooden ramps on his BMX.

verbs.description: daredevil (third-person singular simple present daredevils, present participle daredevilling or (US) daredeviling, simple past and past participle daredevilled or (US) daredeviled)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To behave in a reckless, adventurous, or physically risky manner.
